Reuse of European Commission Documents - AI and Privacy Enhancing Technologies

This document, originating from the Publications Office of the European Union, outlines the reuse policy for European Commission documents, specifically referencing Commission Decision 2011/833/EU. It establishes that the document can be reused under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) license, provided appropriate credit is given and any modifications are clearly indicated. The core focus of the document is on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Privacy Enhancing Technologies, exploring the application of these technologies. A significant portion is dedicated to Federated Learning, a key area of AI research and development. The document provides a detailed examination of Federated Learning, defining the concept and categorizing different models. It specifically differentiates between horizontal and vertical classifications of Federated Learning models. The content is structured around a clear progression, beginning with an Executive Summary and then delving into the technical aspects of Federated Learning. The document’s relevance stems from the increasing interest in Federated Learning as a method for training AI models without directly accessing sensitive data, thereby addressing privacy concerns. The inclusion of ISBN, ISSN, and DOI (10.2804/5357101 QT-01-24-000-EN-N) indicates a formally published and accessible resource, likely intended for researchers, policymakers, and anyone interested in the intersection of AI, data privacy, and distributed learning. The document’s focus on both the theoretical understanding and practical classification of Federated Learning models positions it as a valuable resource for those seeking to understand and utilize this technology effectively. The European Union's commitment to promoting innovation in AI, coupled with its emphasis on data protection, is clearly reflected in this publication.
